title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 8800.1 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 8800.1 - Definitions

State Regulations
(a) Advisory
opinion means a statement described in State Administrative Procedure Act, section 204(2)(b) issued by the Office of Business Permits and Regulatory

Assistance with respect to whether any agency action meets the definition of
rule contained in State Administrative Procedure Act, section 102(2) and
therefore should be adopted as a rule pursuant to article 2 of the State

Administrative Procedure Act in order to be effective. (b) Declaratory ruling means a statement
described in State Administrative Procedure Act, section 204(1)(ii) issued by
an agency pursuant to such section with respect to whether any action by it
meets the definition of rule contained in State Administrative Procedure Act, section 102(2) and therefore requires adoption as a rule pursuant to article 2
of the State Administrative Procedure Act in order to be effective. (c) Office means the Office of Business

Permits and Regulatory Assistance established by article 39 of the Executive

Law. (d) Party means any person who
petitions for an advisory opinion or the agency whose action is the subject of
a petition for an advisory opinion. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
8800.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
